data.title: Grammy Awards
data.meta_description: The Grammy Awards (stylized as GRAMMY) are presented annually by the National Academy of Recording Arts and Sciences of the United States for outstanding achievements in the music industry. Taylor Swift has won 14 Grammy Awards from 52 nominations. She is the second youngest person to win the...
data.text:
“ To be recognized by the Grammys is the ultimate honor. ”

The Grammy Awards (stylized as GRAMMY) are presented annually by the National Academy of Recording Arts and Sciences of the United States for outstanding achievements in the music industry.

Taylor Swift has won 14 Grammy Awards from 52 nominations. She is the second youngest person to win the Album of the Year award and the twelfth female artist with the most awards. She is the first female artist to win Album of the Year twice, as well as being the first artist in history to win the award four times (with Fearless in 2010, 1989 in 2016, Folklore in 2021, and Midnights in 2024).

Colbie Caillat) Best Pop Collaboration With Vocals Nominated 2012 Speak Now Best Country Album Nominated "Mean" Best Country Solo Performance Won Best Country Song Won 2013 "We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together" Record of the Year Nominated "Safe & Sound" (feat. The Civil Wars) Best Country Duo/Group Performance Nominated Best Song Written for Visual Media Won 2014 Red Album of the Year Nominated Best Country Album Nominated "Begin Again" Best Country Song Nominated "Highway Don't Care" (with Tim McGraw and Keith Urban) Best Country Duo/Group Performance Nominated 2015 "Shake It Off" Record of the Year Nominated Song of the Year Nominated Best Pop Solo Performance Nominated 2016 1989 Album of the Year Won Best Pop Vocal Album Won "Blank Space" Record of the Year Nominated Song of the Year Nominated Best Pop Solo Performance Nominated "Bad Blood" (featuring Kendrick Lamar) Best Pop Duo/Group Performance Nominated Best Music Video Won 2018 "Better Man" Best Country Song Nominated "I Don't Wanna Live Forever" Best Song Written for Visual Media Nominated 2019 reputation Best Pop Vocal Album Nominated 2020 Lover Best Pop Vocal Album Nominated "Lover" Song of the Year Nominated "You Need to Calm Down" Best Pop Solo Performance Nominated 2021 "Beautiful Ghosts" Best Song Written for Visual Media Nominated folklore Best Pop Vocal Album Nominated Album of the Year Won "cardigan" Song of the Year Nominated Best Solo Performance Nominated "exile" (featuring Bon Iver) Best Pop Duo/Group Performance Nominated 2022 evermore Album of the Year Nominated 2023 "I Bet You Think About Me" Best Country Song Nominated "Carolina" (from Where the Crawdads Sing) Best Song Written for Visual Media Nominated All Too Well: The Short Film Best Music Video, Short Form Won "All Too Well (10 Minute Version) (The Short Film)" Song of the Year Nominated 2024 "Anti-Hero" Nominated Record of the Year Nominated Best Pop Solo Performance Nominated "Karma" (featuring Ice Spice) Best Pop Duo/Group Performance Nominated Midnights Album of the Year Won Best Pop Vocal Album Won

Year Event Song(s) 2008 51st Grammy Nominations Concert "I'm Sorry"

"White Horse " 2009 51st Grammy Awards "Fifteen" (with Miley Cyrus) 2010 52nd Grammy Awards "Today Was A Fairytale"

"Rhiannon" (with Stevie Nicks)

"You Belong with Me" (with Stevie Nicks) 2012 54th Grammy Awards "Mean" 2013 55th Grammy Awards "We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together" 2014 56th Grammy Awards "All Too Well" 2016 58th Grammy Awards "Out of the Woods" 2021 63rd Grammy Awards "cardigan"/"august"/"willow"

2024[]

Swift was nominated for 6 awards during the 2024 Grammy Awards. She won Best Pop Vocal Album and Album of the Year for Midnights. With this Album of the Year win, she became the first artist in history to win four Album of the Year awards.[1] After Céline Dion presented Taylor Swift with her Album of the Year, a Grammy viewer updated a short video of Swift turning to thank[2] Dion friendly after she finished her speech and the announcer cut the camera, to which Dion responded, "You're welcome".[3] Swift later shared a backstage photo of herself and Dion hugging as well.[4]

Swift announced her eleventh studio album. The Tortured Poets Department. when receiving the award for Best Pop Vocal Album for Midnights.
